title: Electrical Engineering: Opportunities for University Graduates
description:
Come build community, explore your passions and do your best work at Microsoft with thousands of University students from every corner of the world. This opportunity will allow you to bring your aspirations, talent, potential—and excitement for the journey ahead.

As an Electrical Engineer at Microsoft, you will design, develop, modify, and evaluate components used in electronic devices that involve the manipulation, transmission, and storage of electricity. Define design approaches, implementation schedules, technical specifications, and parameters for devices. You will partake in selecting materials and components based on analysis of specifications and reliability. This opportunity will allow you to develop test plans and direct support personnel, or other engineers, in the preparation and execution of design testing or prototype fabrication.

Those hired into this role are invited to participate in the Microsoft Aspire Experience, a two-year learning and development program in which you'll build your network, cultivate intentional capabilities, and gain perspective into the career opportunities across Microsoft’s many exciting businesses.

Microsoft’s mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. As employees we come together with a growth mindset, innovate to empower others, and collaborate to realize our shared goals. Each day we build on our values of respect, integrity, and accountability to create a culture of inclusion where everyone can thrive at work and beyond.

Responsibilities
Develops design documentation for well-defined features and review supplier or partner technical sheets. You’ll also analyze data analyses to identify common flaws in feature or product designs.
Ensures documentation includes test requirements, determine appropriate test equipment, and carry out test plans on standard features or products.
Collect data for external testing, as well as help develop test fixtures for new feature testing and validation.
Implementates schedules for a feature or product while highlighting potential downstream issues. You’ll also help implement risk assessments and communicate progress within the team.
Creates detailed reports for a product feature or extension. This will include documenting essential details and accurate recording and tracking design changes with guidance.
Qualifications
Required Qualifications
Recently completed a Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, or related field.
3+ months related technical engineering experience or internship experience

Electrical Engineering IC2 - The typical base pay range for this role across the U.S. is USD $76,400 - $151,800 per year. There is a different range applicable to specific work locations, within the San Francisco Bay area and New York City metropolitan area, and the base pay range for this role in those locations is USD $100,300 - $165,400 per year.

Certain roles may be eligible for benefits and other compensation. Find additional benefits and pay information here: https://careers.microsoft.com/us/en/us-corporate-pay

Microsoft accepts applications and processes offers for these roles on an ongoing basis throughout the academic calendar (September – April).

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.

title: Senior Materials Engineer
description:
Job Title: Senior Materials Engineer (Level I-II)
Apply: https://airtable.com/appoDeZ5jTvNqFDNY/shrh06JdB0IPgk5R9?prefill_Job+Title=Senior+Materials+Engineer
More Info: https://www.solvusglobal.com/careers
Desired Start: ASAP
Job Type: Full Time, Salary
At Solvus Global, We Are… Innovators, Engineers, Entrepreneurs, Makers, Creators, Dreamers, DOERS
Solvus Global is a technology innovation company focused on solving problems in the materials and manufacturing space. We are a diverse team of engineers & scientists dedicated to leveraging our Knowledge Capital to develop critical solutions for our customers. Often, those solutions have much greater impact than just one organization and so we focus our innovations on Targeted Commercialization. Our team spins out core technology areas into standalone startups ready to build a team, raise capital, and launch a product/service that solves a critical challenge across entire market sectors in the materials & manufacturing space.
The Opportunity with Solvus Global Is… Dynamic, Engaging, Cross-Disciplinary, Cutting-Edge, Flexible, EMPOWERING
We are looking for a full-time Senior Materials Engineer who loves working in a dynamic environment and is excited to grow with a team around advanced additive technologies. As a materials engineer with Solvus Global you will work with team members from many fields (mechanical, controls, software, etc.) to identify part-production opportunities, define the material and process challenges, develop the process & procedure, validate the process, and ultimately deploy the process into full production. As a Senior materials engineer on this team, you will especially be responsible for driving rapid innovation in material and process development, as well as interfacing with external customers to ensure that our teams meet their needs. Your day-to-day responsibilities will include leading team activities, developing processing parameters, building large parts for customers, selecting ideal materials, designing fixturing, and driving the business case for advanced manufacturing.
Required Attributes & Skills
4-10 years of practical experience (or 0-4 with PhD) in technical materials testing & analysis role
Experience leading teams in project execution
Ability to take and give direction well as well as excellent communication skills
Demonstrated capability of interfacing with external customers
Desire to develop new skills on the job
Advantageous Attributes & Skills
Degree in Mechanical, Materials or Welding Engineering
Experience in additive manufacturing or metallic coatings strongly desired
Desire to work in a team-based environment
Experience in revenue generation and strong understanding of business value
Strong desire to understand both technology and business aspects of engineering
Experience with metallographic analysis, mechanical testing, non-destructive evaluation, and/or failure analysis
US Person and ability to work on Export Controlled Projects
Job Type: Full-time
Pay: $96,000.00 - $150,000.00 per year
Benefits:
401(k)
401(k) matching
Dental insurance
Employee assistance program
Flexible schedule
Flexible spending account
Health insurance
Health savings account
Life insurance
Paid time off
Vision insurance
Schedule:
8 hour shift
Monday to Friday
Work Location: Hybrid remote in Worcester, MA 01605

title: Materials Engineer | Glass & Ceramics
description:
Summary

Posted: Jan 10, 2024

Role Number:200533031

Here at Apple, the development and integration of revolutionary materials into our products is essential to the mechanical integrity, aesthetics, and overall feel our customers have come to expect. These materials are a critical aspect of what makes Apple products the best electronic devices in the world! Our Materials Engineering Product Design team is dedicated to creating and optimizing these materials. We influence and enable innovative enclosure designs across all Apple product lines year after year. We work with the utmost attention to detail, directly impacting the design of products that millions of people around the world love. As a Materials Engineer | Glass & Ceramics within the Materials Product Design organization, you will drive the rapid advancement of materials and processes that are the foundation of Apple devices. Working closely with multi-functional teams and external vendors, you will determine the optimal engineering paths to meet the stringent requirements in future Apple products. Are you ready to help us take our products to the next level?

Key Qualifications

Key Qualifications
Minimum 3 years experience in relevant industry
Strong materials fundamentals in structure-properties relationship
Knowledge of different materials characterization and analysis methods (i.e. SEM, EDS, XRD, Raman, Spectrophotometers, etc)
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, including the ability to use statistical tools and techniques
Demonstrated ability to independently, drive projects, and deliver products
Communicate effectively with team members, providing technical expertise and updates on project milestones
Familiarity with brittle material finishing technologies (highly preferred)
Technical knowledge of glass, glass-ceramics or structural ceramics (highly preferred)


Description

Description

As a Materials Engineer | Glass & Ceramics, you will work with a team of multi-functional partners and external vendors to develop, test, and validate new material solutions for a wide range of Apple products. Your ability to deep dive into material fundamentals, creatively solve challenging problems, and collaborate well with interdisciplinary teams is key to delivering the best material solutions and products to our customers. This position will require occasional domestic or international travel (<10>

Education & Experience

Education & Experience

BS/MS/PhD in Materials Science, Mechanical Engineering, Chemistry or Physics

Additional Requirements

Additional Requirements
Apple benefits programs vary by country and are subject to eligibility requirements.
Apple is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. We take affirmative action to ensure equal opportunity for all applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, Veteran status, or other legally protected characteristics. Apple is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to applicants with physical and mental disabilities. Apple is a drug-free workplace.


Pay & Benefits

Pay & Benefits
At Apple, base pay is one part of our total compensation package and is determined within a range. This provides the opportunity to progress as you grow and develop within a role. The base pay range for this role is between $131,500.00 and $243,300.00, and your base pay will depend on your skills, qualifications, experience, and location.

Apple employees also have the opportunity to become an Apple shareholder through participation in Apple’s discretionary employee stock programs. Apple employees are eligible for discretionary restricted stock unit awards, and can purchase Apple stock at a discount if voluntarily participating in Apple’s Employee Stock Purchase Plan. You’ll also receive benefits including: Comprehensive medical and dental coverage, retirement benefits, a range of discounted products and free services, and for formal education related to advancing your career at Apple, reimbursement for certain educational expenses - including tuition. Additionally, this role might be eligible for discretionary bonuses or commission payments as well as relocation. Learn more about Apple Benefits.

Note: Apple benefit, compensation and employee stock programs are subject to eligibility requirements and other terms of the applicable plan or program.

Apple is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. title: Materials Engineering Manager (Remote Eligible, U.S.)
description:
Job Description Summary
The Materials Engineering Manager will be responsible for providing leadership, direction, development and resource management of a technical team of engineers and scientists supporting GEH Nuclear and Plant Services Engineering initiatives. In addition, you will manage complex issues within the functional area of expertise, be involved in long-term planning, and contribute to the overall engineering strategy.

The preferred work location for this role is at the GEH Headquarters in Wilmington, NC; but highly qualified (US based) remote candidates will be considered.
Job Description
Roles and Responsibilities
You will have ownership and accountability for material engineering activities that support GEH Nuclear spanning the entire GEH portfolio.
You will be responsible for driving GEH’s Safety, Quality, Delivery, Cost (SQDC) standards and all Environmental Health and Safety activities/requirements related to the team.
You will be responsible for team CAP activities and implement all necessary corrective and preventive actions resulting from quality non-compliance monitoring and audit programs.
You will be accountable for team KPI forecast accuracy.
You will be responsible for bid management activities ensuring engineering deliverables are well defined, estimates and resource loaded schedules are developed and risks identified and documented.
You will be accountability for delivering products and services on-time and on-budget.
You will be responsible for team resource planning and project/program assignments.
You will work collaboratively across the engineering matrix and with business leaders in Product Development, Project Delivery, Sourcing and Quality to ensure close coordination of technical inputs/outputs, project/product requirements, workforce planning/scheduling and risk management.
You will be accountable for team individual development and knowledge management activities.
You will have ownership to streamline, integrate and develop team technical and management processes to better support business needs across the organization through Lean and/or Six Sigma methodology.
You will act as a technical liaise with customers, partner organizations and suppliers as necessary and in close partnership/coordination with Product Development and Project Delivery leaders.
Partner with business teams and presents product/program strategies, technical roadmaps, risks and recommendations to senior leads across GEH.
Required Qualifications
B.S. Degree in Engineering Discipline (Materials, Nuclear, Mechanical, Chemical or similar).
Minimum 7 years of experience in a technology or engineering role.
Operating at a senior level within the organization.
Excellent writing and verbal communications skills.
Demonstrated people management and motivation skills.
Eligibility Requirements
The preferred work location for this role is at the GEH Headquarters in Wilmington, NC; but highly qualified (US based) remote candidates will be considered.
Less than 10% travel required.
Desired Characteristics
Master’s degree or PhD in an engineering or technical discipline.
Experience managing highly technical and diverse Engineering teams and functions.
Strong Leadership skills.
Knowledge of working within a regulated environment (nuclear).
Knowledge of quality standards and systems (e.g., NQA-1 and ISO 9000)
Strong organization skills.
Strong problem-solving abilities.
Prior experience in project delivery and working within a matrix environment.
Strong customer mindset.
Ability to work to tight deadlines and cope under pressure.
Six Sigma training is preferred.
Strong oral and written communication skills.
Strong interpersonal skills
The salary range for this position is $128-202k. The specific salary offered to a candidate may be influenced by a variety of factors including the candidate’s experience, their education, and the work location. In addition, this position is eligible for a performance bonus.
Available health and welfare benefits include healthcare, prescription drug, dental, and vision coverage; savings account options (such as a Health Care Flexible Savings Account, Health Reimbursement Account, Limited Purpose Flexible Spending Account, and Dependent Care Flexible Spending Account); and an employee assistance program. Additional benefits include a defined contribution 401(k) plan, employee life insurance, optional dependent life insurance, employee accidental death or dismemberment insurance coverage, salary continuance program benefits for disability, optional long-term disability, pre-tax transportation/commuter program, paid holidays, paid time off, parental leave, a layoff plan for salaried employees, tuition reimbursement program, use of Cariloop, adoption assistance, optional identity theft prevention insurance, optional personal legal assistance, and optional personal excess liability insurance.
#LI-BB1
This role requires access to U.S. export-controlled information. If applicable, final offers will be contingent on ability to obtain authorization for access to U.S. export-controlled information from the U.S. Government.
Additional Information
GE offers a great work environment, professional development, challenging careers, and competitive compensation. GE is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.
GE will only employ those who are legally authorized to work in the United States for this opening. Any offer of employment is conditioned upon the successful completion of a drug screen (as applicable).
Relocation Assistance Provided: Yes
#LI-Remote - This is a remote position

title: Engineering Program Specialist - Materials and Inventory
description:
Our client, a global financial service and digital payments company, is seeking an Engineering Program Specialist - Materials and Inventory who will work closely with the Engineering Program Coordination Team to ensure adequate material supply for our in-house DUT (Device Under Test) Bundle builds. You are a customer-focused organizer who can manage rapid changes, prioritize, and track the details. This contract role reports to the lead of the Engineering Program Coordination Team. This role is open to people who can work onsite at our Client's beautiful Oakland office. Overtime may be requested occasionally.

This position is an on-site 7-month contract. You must be able to work in Oakland, CA, and have no H1B Visa status. The hourly rate is $53.45, W2 + paid holidays through Talent Table. NO C2C.

Responsibilities:
Create and manage purchase orders to ensure inventory arrives to schedule requirements; maintain purchasing logs.
Create spreadsheet material demand plans from BOMs.
Cycle count and manage physical inventory such as infrastructure boards and materials.
Track and manage goods receipts, spend, and invoicing; reconcile inventory.
Receive goods, label, and shelve within our device room. Ship, distribute, and track units and materials. Maintain shipping and inventory logs.
Manage suppliers, consigned materials, clear-to-build report, and purchase orders of board and DUT Bundles. Ensure timely resolution of any issues. Coordinate testing.
Assist with staffing our device request help desk and work on Device Room improvements and projects.
Work closely with the cross-functional teams to ensure product designs are accurately defined and documented by the Bill of Materials (BOMs). Write Engineering Change Requests (ECRs), Deviations, and Change Orders (ECOs). Create simple build configuration spreadsheets.
Guide internal and Joint Development teams to provide design documentation in time to support approval deadlines. Coordinate readiness checklist (OK2) reviews and approval activities for electrical and mechanical design releases.
Communicate status, key updates, and risks.
Develop, document, improve, and present processes that allow our internal and partner teams to do our best work.

You Have:
Purchasing experience.
Proficiency with complex spreadsheets, including creating and using formulas and functions.
Understanding of configuration management principles, experience with ECOs and BOMs.
Knowledge of electrical and mechanical components and their assemblies, preferably for consumer electronics.
The ability to exert force and/or lift or carry items safely weighing twenty-five (25) to forty (40) pounds occasionally and up to ten (10) pounds regularly.
AS/BS in a related field or equivalent experience in a technology environment (3+ years of industry experience in a similar role).

Nice to have:
Ability to travel internationally, international shipping experience, Arena experience.

title: Game Engineering Co-Op
description:
Team Name:
Diablo IV
Job Title:
Game Engineering Co-Op
Requisition ID:
R022783
Job Description:
Game Engineering Co-Op

Player Profile
Pursuing an associates, bachelors, or masters and graduating December 2024 – July 2025
Enrolled in a college or university that offers co-op programs
Available to participate in a co-op from June 17th to December 13th
Currently residing in the US or open to relocating oneself to the US
Exhibits learning agility; has the ability to think differently, and/or grasp and apply new skills and concepts
Approaches problems in a clear, well-organized, and solutions-oriented manner
Works well with others and contributes to team tasks
Able to effectively communicate problems, solutions, needs, or priorities
Is engaged, seeks to learn, and is able to manage time effectively
A passion for significantly impacting game development
Candidates must apply with a resume and a link to their code samples to be considered

Co-Op Opportunities
All Co-Ops will be conducted in-person. Hosting managers will determine when and how often Co-Ops work in the office Monday-Friday (living stipend provided to all Co-Op).

Co-Op location: Albany, NY

Engine Engineering Co-Op: Work with the team that provides the main architecture on which our game is built. The engine team is responsible for many areas including but not exclusive to: UI/UX, Animation, VFX, Physics, Audio, Platform technologies, Pipelines, Performance and Stability, Threading and Streaming. Your role with us will be in helping to add new features, extend current technologies, and address bugs. All of which will greatly empower our team at large to make awesome content.
Proficient in C++
A strong understanding of data structures and memory management.
Prior exposure to a common game engine such as Unreal.
An eagerness to collaborate and interface with content creator teams.

Tools Engineering Co-Op: Work with the team that creates the tools that the team uses to build the content of Diablo IV. The Tools Team is responsible for many areas including but not exclusive to: UI/UX, Workflow Improvement, Data Manipulation, Data Management, Source Control Interactions, and Interfacing with DCCs (Digital Content Creation Tools). Our tools are the means through which all our developers realize their ideas. Your role with us will be to help us expand the possibility space.

Proficient in at least one programming language, preferably C#
Strong knowledge of data structures and working with large data sets
Passion for improving workflows and enabling the creativity of the Diablo team
Preference for students with previous experience in creating developer tools

We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all qualifications? Let us decide! Research shows that women and members of other under-represented groups tend to not apply to jobs when they think they may not meet every qualification, when, in fact, they often do! At Activision Blizzard, we are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and strongly encourage you to apply.

Your Platform
We are looking for talented and innovative students to join our team for the 2024 summer. All students will receive a meaningful project and an unparalleled experience. We’ll provide the tools and resources you need to learn new skills/technology while you collaborate with some of the best in the gaming industry. The challenging and creative work you do throughout your co-op will directly impact the team you are contributing on. In addition to your day-to-day work, you’ll participate in summer exclusive Learning & Development and social events (virtual and in-person).

Our World
Activision Blizzard, Inc. (NASDAQ: ATVI), is one of the world's largest and most successful interactive entertainment companies and is at the intersection of media, technology and entertainment. We are home to some of the most beloved entertainment franchises including Call of Duty®, World of Warcraft®, Overwatch®, Diablo®, Candy Crush™ and Bubble Witch™. Our combined entertainment network delights hundreds of millions of monthly active users in 196 countries, making us the largest gaming network on the planet!
Our ability to build immersive and innovate worlds is only enhanced by diverse teams working in an inclusive environment. We aspire to have a culture where everyone can thrive in order to connect and engage the world through epic entertainment. We provide a suite of benefits that promote physical, emotional and financial well-being for ‘Every World’ - we’ve got our employees covered!
The videogame industry and therefore our business is fast-paced and will continue to evolve. As such, the duties and responsibilities of this role may be changed as directed by the Company at any time to promote and support our business and relationships with industry partners.
Activision Blizzard is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable law and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.
We are committed to working with and providing reasonable assistance to individuals with physical and mental disabilities. If you are a disabled individual requiring an accommodation to apply for an open position, please email your request to accommodationrequests@activisionblizzard.com General employment questions cannot be accepted or processed here. Thank you for your interest.
Rewards
We provide a suite of benefits that promote physical, emotional and financial well-being for ‘Every World’ - we’ve got our employees covered! Subject to eligibility requirements, the Company offers comprehensive benefits including:
Medical, dental, vision, health savings account or health reimbursement account, healthcare spending accounts, dependent care spending accounts, life and AD&D insurance, disability insurance;
401(k) with Company match, tuition reimbursement, charitable donation matching;
Paid holidays and vacation, paid sick time, floating holidays, compassion and bereavement leaves, parental leave;
Mental health & wellbeing programs, fitness programs, free and discounted games, and a variety of other voluntary benefit programs like supplemental life & disability, legal service, ID protection, rental insurance, and others;
If the Company requires that you move geographic locations for the job, then you may also be eligible for relocation assistance.
Eligibility to participate in these benefits may vary for part time and temporary full-time employees and interns with the Company. You can learn more by visiting https://www.benefitsforeveryworld.com/.
In the U.S., the standard base pay range for this role is $20.00 - $50.00 Hourly. These values reflect the expected base pay range of new hires across all U.S. locations. Ultimately, your specific range and offer will be based on several factors, including relevant experience, performance, and work location. Your Talent Professional can share this role’s range details for your local geography during the hiring process. In addition to a competitive base pay, employees in this role may be eligible for incentive compensation. Incentive compensation is not guaranteed.

title: Quality Engineering Technician, General Assembly Model 3, Closures & Exteriors
description:

What to Expect
Quality Engineering Technician for Exterior & Closures will support quality engineer to improve quality for customer
Technician will maintainly follow day to day quality dashboard for top issue investigation and assembly station audit to identify potential root-cause of on-going quality concerns
Technician will also support data collection & documentation of data for quality investigation as well as containment action of urgent quality issue such as part sort and rework process
Technician will work closely with engineer to drive temporary & permanent countermeasure of final yield quality and customer field issue

Monitor Exterior and Closure quality to investigate daily quality issue and proactively contain quickly emerging issue for customer quality improvement
Review exterior and closure part assembly stations to support production proper process management and analyze risk for quality process management

Draft documentation for quality alert to notify inspection or process for proper inspection or management of process to create awareness high risk Issue SCAR/TSORT promptly to contain urgent issue to protect customer quality management

Basic documentation skill (MS word, excel, PowerPoint)
Precise data collection and analysis skill with basic data measurement tool capability & chart/table drafting skills
2+years of manufacturing background

title: Manufacturing Engineer, Cell Assembly
description:
Tesla participates in the E-Verify Program
What to Expect
Tesla is looking for a highly motivated Mechanical development engineer to create, develop and scale up manufacturing processes for our cutting-edge Tesla battery cell manufacturing line. This role will invent, develop, scale up and optimize battery manufacturing processes within a cross-functional engineering team responsible for the development lifecycle and launch into manufacturing. In this role, you will work closely with many organizations both internal and external to Tesla taking new battery designs from initial concept through into full production.

The battery cell is a critical component in Tesla vehicles and storage systems. This role will have the opportunity to make meaningful contributions to our products. The work environment is demanding, fast-paced and incredibly exciting. The ideal candidate should be ready to push their limits, as they join in highly motivated and capable team to make unbelievable things happen.
What You’ll Do
Drive development of new/innovative manufacturing processes from proof of concept through to full scale production that enable improved battery performance and/or cost
Be an expert leader in the technical discussion and define process and Equipment development roadmap for Cell assembly processes – Metal forming/ Dispensing battery cell technology
Work with internal and external teams to develop innovative process, product and equipment design solutions to advance battery performance and cell manufacturing
Plan and Execute DoEs to characterize boundary conditions and optimize process for manufacturability and quality
Develop and manage PFMEA, DFMEA risk assessments to prioritize process improvement projects and ensure adequate metrology and controls are in place
Use tools like Minitab/JMP for data analysis and presentation of experimental data
Establish process controls for SPC and develop process related OCAPs
Lead product design for manufacturability (DFM), DFMEA and sustainability, including:
Analysis of product design and identification of potential risks to the process
Build process documentation to accurately define the process to cross-functional teams (equipment, quality, production, etc.)
What You’ll Bring
Bachelor's Degree in Mechanical Engineering, Manufacturing Engineering, Chemical Engineering, relevant experience, or equivalent

3+ years relevant experience in interdisciplinary/integrated engineering, process development, manufacturing engineering, or 1+ year in Battery R&D and Manufacturing in a commercial lithium-ion environment
In-depth understanding and knowledge of lithium-ion battery technology including material selection, fabrication, and synthesis; new battery cell design, assembly, testing, and failure mode analysis. Hands-on experience with lithium-ion battery cell product development is a strong plus
Experience with Metal forming/Stamping/dispensing applications is preferred
Demonstrated capabilities in manufacturing process development for new products and Ability to transfer technologies from R&D into manufacturing is required
Proven ability to successfully manage multiple projects and meet deliverable deadlines amidst changing requirements, deadlines, and priorities
Manufacturing process specification and evaluation experience
Compensation and Benefits
Benefits

Along with competitive pay, as a full-time Tesla employee, you are eligible for the following benefits at day 1 of hire:
Aetna PPO and HSA plans > 2 medical plan options with $0 payroll deduction
Family-building, fertility, adoption and surrogacy benefits
Dental (including orthodontic coverage) and vision plans, both have options with a $0 paycheck contribution
Company Paid (Health Savings Account) HSA Contribution when enrolled in the High Deductible Aetna medical plan with HSA
Healthcare and Dependent Care Flexible Spending Accounts (FSA)
LGBTQ+ care concierge services
401(k) with employer match, Employee Stock Purchase Plans, and other financial benefits
Company paid Basic Life, AD&D, short-term and long-term disability insurance
Employee Assistance Program
Sick and Vacation time (Flex time for salary positions), and Paid Holidays
Back-up childcare and parenting support resources
Voluntary benefits to include: critical illness, hospital indemnity, accident insurance, theft & legal services, and pet insurance
Weight Loss and Tobacco Cessation Programs
Tesla Babies program
Commuter benefits
Employee discounts and perks program

$80,000 - $258,000/annual salary + cash and stock awards + benefits

title: Engineering R&D Graduate
description:
At IMI, we make the world a better place through new thinking and technology. We design, manufacture and service products that control the precise movement of fluids. We apply our expertise across a huge range of industries, from life sciences to green energy to indoor climate control.
Join our Life Science & Fluid Technology sector, on the IMI Graduate Programme in Palmer, USA, and you’ll gain unique R&D experience. IMI Adaptas is a market leader in electron multipliers, which are a key component for most mass spectrometers; with continual improvement and breakthrough innovations being required to keep our position in the market. As customers push the limits of the technology, we also need to enhance our internal testing capabilities to ensure our products will meet our customers’ expectations. We are investing in the required hardware technology to do this.
In this role, you will support the R&D team in several areas, including:
Analysis of current production data of top 20 EM models looking for trends in performance data.
Test and analyse performance of the electron multipliers.
Automate data analysis for electron multipliers. Specifically, the collection of current pulses followed by peak height and peak area analysis.
Evaluate production system, test, and detail an improvement path.
Participate in the evaluation of new detector designs with particular emphasis on optimizing and evaluating AC coupling hardware.
Learn basic operating principles of electron multipliers and mass spectrometers. Participate in other group projects as time permits and opportunities arise.
What you need:
You will need a bachelor’s or master’s degree (or equivalent) in Electrical/Electronic Engineering, Physics, Chemistry or general Engineering. We’d also like to see some key qualities in our candidates, including:
A fresh, innovative approach
Open to new and varied experiences
Experience in data analysis, software development, instrument control and test automation
Interest in learning about mass spectrometry and analytical instrumentation
Excellent organisation with the ability to work efficiently in fast-paced environments
Positive approach and drive to develop
Fluent in written and spoken local language
Must be a US Citizen or a permanent resident
We believe that the more diverse we are as a company, the better representation and difference we can make for the communities we serve. It’s important that candidates looking to apply can reflect our safe, inclusive culture that celebrates difference.
What we offer:
We want you to feel proud and rewarded for the work that you’ll do each day. That’s why we’ll offer a highly competitive salary from the first day you join us at IMI. On top of that, you’ll also have access to a great benefits package. During your time at IMI, you will uncover and apply your strengths through supported and actionable learning. You will be empowered to own your own development, be a valued member of our One Big Team, and help us solve industry problems, capture growth quickly and continually improve.
Our programme offers the opportunity to work across multiple locations, dependent upon business need, which means you may need to relocate. This could be within the country you’re applying for, sometimes it may be to another country.
Job Type: Full-time
Salary: From $81,000.00 per year
Benefits:
Life insurance
Referral program

Under 1 year
Schedule:
8 hour shift
Work Location: In person

title: Engineering Build Manager
location: 2788 San Tomas Expressway, Santa Clara, CA 95051
description:
NVIDIA is the leader in groundbreaking developments in Artificial Intelligence, High-Performance Computing and Visualization. The GPU, our invention, serves as the visual cortex of modern computers and is at the heart of our products and services. Our work opens up new universes to explore, enables amazing creativity and discovery, and powers what were once science fiction inventions from artificial intelligence to autonomous cars.
NVIDIA is looking for extraordinary people like you to help us accelerate the next wave of artificial intelligence. Engineering Build Manager is responsible for all the engineering build activities for a new NVIDIA product, leading multi-functional teams to successfully plan and execute the HW prototype (boards & systems) builds, ensuring all internal customers have enough prototypes for their respective development and test activities with high quality standards and the correct HW & SW configuration during the project development phase.
What you'll be doing:
Independently create and update plans that achieve project objectives
Identify/track key milestones, evaluate/acquire/handle resources
Resolve accurate number of prototypes (boards & systems) needed by each group for each prototype engineering build
Interact with suppliers and vendors
Define tasks, drive assignments and lead the progress
Optimize engineering build planning, cost, schedule, logistics, staffing, testing, communication/reporting, implementation and execution along with the CM/OEM partners
Identify risks and develop/execute risk management plans and Ensure proper prototype distribution in timely manner
Regularly provide leadership team with project status reports
Assist in improving existing models, processes and help feedback to improve infrastructure
What we need to see:
5+ years experience in a similar role, preferably within an engineering, manufacturing/operations environment
BS EE/IE degree or equivalent experience
Strong manufacturing and R&D background and Knowledge of project management techniques and tools
Strong organizational skills and the ability to interact effectively with people at all levels of NVIDIA
Very strong leadership, facilitation, problem solving and project management skills are required to be successful in this role
Consistent track record of leading the release of quality projects into manufacturing
Experience in working with suppliers, vendors and/or customers
Capability to quick learn, understand, communicate and integrate technical concepts and issues
Ability to travel, as needed. This role could exceed 30% travel for certain projects
Ways to stand out from the crowd:
Deep understanding of technology and passionate about what you do
Strong collaborative and social skills, and ability to effectively guide and influence within a dynamic, multifaceted environment
NVIDIA offers highly competitive salaries and a comprehensive benefits package. We have some of the most forward-thinking and hardworking people in the world on our team and our collaborative talent continues to drive NVIDIA's growth. We are seeking creative and independent engineers with real passion for technology!
The base salary range is 128,000 USD - 247,250 USD. Your base salary will be determined based on your location, experience, and the pay of employees in similar positions.
You will also be eligible for equity and
benefits
. NVIDIA accepts applications on an ongoing basis.
NVIDIA is committed to fostering a diverse work environment and proud to be an equal opportunity employer. title: Lab Technician, Cell Cathode Engineering
description:
Tesla participates in the E-Verify Program
What to Expect
Tesla is looking for a lab chemical analysis technician to assist lab operation in advanced chemical analysis techniques such as ICP-OES, IC, and AA techniques, the candidate will be a core member of an interdisciplinary materials research and development team focusing on developing high-performance electrode materials for Li ion batteries.
What You’ll Do
Independently operating ICP-OES, IC, and AA instruments for solution elemental analysis
Independently operating various solid sample digestion equipment including mixed-acid digestion, microwave digestion, and fusion digestion
Routine analytical instruments and digestion equipment maintenance and troubleshooting
Assist engineer in analytical method development and analytical data management including data entry and data analysis / reporting
Communicate with engineers and technicians working on various projects requiring the chemical analysis on the results and provide feedbacks on analytical data quality and reliability
Lab chemicals / materials inventory management
Assist engineer for Lab EHS compliance and safety management and ensure proper chemical waste handling
What You’ll Bring
Technical background in Chemistry, Chemical Engineering, or Materials Science / Metallurgy
1+ years of experience working with wet chemical analysis (ICP-OES, IC, AA, titration, pH), solid materials digestion, and solution sample preparation
Able to pay attention to details to provide consistent high-quality output for solid sample digestion and solution sample preparation
Good computer skills for data analysis and reporting necessary, programming ability using Python and Mathlab is a plus
Able to operate independently and in multi-tasking collaborative environments
Good verbal and written communication skills

title: Process Engineer
description:
Job Location
Cincinnati
Job Description
P&G is the largest consumer packaged goods company in the world. We have operations in over 75 countries, with 65 trusted brands that improve lives for 5 billion consumers worldwide. This brings many advantages, including the opportunity for our employees to enjoy a diverse and rewarding lifelong career filled with new and exciting challenges.
We believe great ideas emerge from the creative connections that happen between our hardworking employees, and we encourage diverse, multi-functional teams to work together to generate new ideas to address challenges we face. P&G has positions available at various technical centers and plants (including Cincinnati) across the United States.
We are seeking a highly motivated leader who will make a difference if the life of others by improving the life of customers through the innovative products offered at Procter & Gamble. In this role you will provide Engineering leadership and support to Procter and Gamble (P&G) site via technical mastery and site-specific coaching. This role is key to keeping P&G as the top producer of consumer goods in the world. The successful individual will be flexible with their working capability to meet P&G expectations, lead various action plan focus items, and implement innovative programs.
In this role you will build an engineering mastery. Provides support on;
Engineering matters for the Business Unit and R&D innovation projects and initiatives
Site engineering issues and problems
Innovation of new and current product lines offered by the company.
Responsible for completing tasks that can range from the creating of a new product line to the development of new packages, the testing of new materials and the conversion of process to pave the way of the future.

Promote agility and work/life effectiveness and your long-term well-being.

title: Engineering Technician, Low Voltage Distribution
description:
Tesla participates in the E-Verify Program
What to Expect
As an engineering technician within the low voltage distribution design team you will build prototype wire harnesses, support component level testing and failure analysis for the LV system. Projects are open-ended and often with limited guidance. The parts you will produce are critical for early vehicle prototypes and other Tesla products and allow design teams to progress in their designs, find flaws and make decisions.
What You’ll Do
Produce or rework wire harnesses in a lab or at vehicles in a shop
Procure wire harness parts and materials from online vendors, Tesla’s suppliers or Tesla internal inventory
Assemble test fixtures for mechanical and electrical validation of new components
Conduct sealing, continuity, durability, and ergonomic testing and create reports
Maintain and organize lab space, materials, tools and equipment needed to make and test wire harnesses and subcomponents
Provide clear, accurate and timely feedback to engineers on problems found during testing or part production
Complete tasks as directed by project schedules
Support tasks that advance Tesla’s wire harness technology
What You’ll Bring
Expertise with wire harness components such as connectors, contact terminals, grounding terminals, splices, wire types, clips, heatshrink and taping
Able to use multimeters, crimping tools, soldering irons, terminal extraction tools
Be able to interpret electrical schematics, harness drawings, verbal or written instructions and translate to physical parts or to the operation of specialized equipment
Experience with repairing vehicle wire harnesses
Basic knowledge of circuitry and how electrical components work
High level of craftsmanship and attention to detail married with the ability to work quickly
Handle requests from multiple teams and work on multiple projects simultaneously
Ability to lift 20-40 lbs. and to maintain a safe working environment
Excellent written & verbal communication and computer skills
Desire to expand the capabilities and knowledge of the team to more advanced harness production and failure analysis techniques

title: Extended End of Line Engineering Technician, Megafactory
description:
Tesla participates in the E-Verify Program
What to Expect
The Extended End-of-Line (EOL) Engineering Technician focuses on troubleshooting, repairing, root-causing, and re-configuring several types of failing and collect infotainment and charging devices back into full working condition. This position will involve gaining an understanding of various components and their interaction within the vehicle. The Extended EOL Engineering Technician analyzes components, equipment, test results, assembly methods, drawing prints, and electrical schematics to determine the true cause of a problem. Once a countermeasure is identified, they also work with the production staff to prevent further recurrences. This position will also use hand tools, computer-based test equipment, and internal databases to analyze and repair product and subassemblies in an efficient manner. An equally important responsibility is to help reman production line with continuous improvements in, quality, safety, and efficiency as well as authoring, troubleshooting, and enhancing assembly instructions.
What You’ll Do
Review field returns to determine reason for return and ensure sufficient documentation exists for the reman process
Troubleshoot, root-cause, and debug an array of infotainment software and hardware, including but not limited to, gateways, CAN/LIN, HSD Ethernet, USB, audio input/output DSP, 4G LTE connectivity, Bluetooth, RF, and radar
Support the reman lines with troubleshooting anomalies and test failures with the goal of determining root cause of return
Perform hands on teardown of special interest MCUs and chargers, including clear documentation in WarpRCA and JIRA
Communicate findings effectively to Design, Manufacturing, Quality, Safety, and other departments
Use standard lab equipment (soldering iron, multi-meter, oscilloscope, power supplies, etc.) and custom test fixtures, and contribute to development of new fixtures and tools
Conduct controlled experiments to test hypotheses and help confirm root cause
What You’ll Bring
Ability to prove record of safety and diligence when working in dangerous environments; comfortable working on compromised HV batteries, experience with PCBA troubleshooting is a plus
Strong understanding of electrical principles (Ohms law, etc.), electrical circuits (resistors, capacitors, diodes, etc.), and basic battery concepts (state of charge, capacity, etc.), including experience with LINUX based operating systems and software is a plus
Proficiency in problem solving tools such as 5 why’s, cause-effect analysis, Pareto charts, 8D’s, Kaizen, etc. is a plus
Experience with soldering, oscilloscopes, and other bench-testing equipment is a plus. Demonstrated ability to learn new concepts quickly; comfortable in ambiguity
Hands-on, proactive approach to problem solving; reliable, innovative, committed, self-starter; quality focused, capable of working unsupervised
Ability to create flowcharts and author manufacturing instructions using workplace software (Word, Excel, Visio), including strong analytical skills with experience collecting and analyzing data sets
Communicate clearly using excellent written and verbal skills across cultures and geographic regions; strong command of English language
Compensation and Benefits
Benefits

title: Cell Engineer, Anode Materials
description:
Tesla participates in the E-Verify Program
What to Expect
Tesla is committed to hiring and developing diverse talent in all disciplines This position will collaborate with multiple teams across Tesla to characterize battery materials, determine degradation mechanisms, and optimize cell performance. Our team is looking for a highly motivated candidate to contribute to battery performance testing and fundamental electrochemical analysis. The candidate will be responsible for supporting the development cell test plans to characterize initial cell performance, lifetime behavior, reliability and identify critical failures and degradation modes. In addition, this candidate will help plan test resources, track test progress, and analyze/report testing results. We want team focused candidates with strong communication skills who challenge and want to be challenged, and who create and innovate. We want teammates who will thrive in a fast-paced company with real hardware and are self-motivated and disciplined.
What You’ll Do
Contribute to our efforts to better understand lithium-ion battery performance and degradation
Be a key member of a cross functional team to help determine the ideal anode composition and design of our future products
Conduct systematic lab-scale studies to design and assess new anode materials
Develop and carry out anode slurry mixing and electrode coating processes
Build and test small cell prototypes (500+ mAh pouch cells)
Analyze electrode performances in prototype cells to determine their relationship with material design and process parameters
Document process parameters and results thoroughly in test reports as well as communicate the key learnings to cross-functional teams
Read and review scientific papers to broaden knowledge and propose new experimental design to address any technical challenges
Maintain and expand clean, safe, and organized working environments
Up to 25% travel required for this position
What You’ll Bring
Bachelor’s Degree or higher in chemical engineering, material science, chemistry, or equivalent
3+ years of experience with cell material design, chemical analysis of battery materials, cell testing, and degradation analysis
Fundamental knowledge of anode active materials (e.g., graphite, silicon) and inactive materials (binder, conductive carbon)
Ability to identify root-causes and conduct troubleshooting to solve issues
Strong communication and organization skills with ability to manage projects independently
Compensation and Benefits

title: Field Engineering Technician
description:
Requisition ID # 156097

Job Category: Maintenance / Construction / Operations
Job Level: Individual Contributor
Business Unit: Gas Operations
Work Type: Onsite
Job Location: Oakland

Department Overview

Gas Operations is focused on ensuring the safe and reliable flow of natural gas to our customers. As a whole, Gas Operations is responsible for all aspects of PG&E's gas distribution and transmission operations, including planning, engineering, maintenance and construction, restoration and emergency response.

Position Summary

This job is represented by Engineers and Scientists of California (ESC) and is subject to collective bargaining.

The Field Engineering Technician inspects, and evaluates various maintenance and construction documentation for quality and compliance with PG&E’s requirements. The FET must be able to interpret documentation which is evidence of compliance with company work procedures. The FET prepares, conducts and documents quality assessments in accordance with established quality review processes. The FET monitors quality, identifies issues, reports findings and may recommend process improvements.

PG&E is providing the hourly rate range that the company in good faith believes it might pay for this position at the time of the job posting. This compensation range is specific to the locality of the job. The actual hourly rate paid to an individual will be based on multiple factors, including, but not limited to, specific skills, education, licenses or certifications, experience, market value, geographic location, collective bargaining agreements, and internal equity. This position is subject to collectively bargained hourly wage rates.

The hourly rate for this position ranges from $42.82 to $60.31. Under the terms of the collective bargaining agreement, the starting hourly rate for this position is $42.82, subject to collectively bargained wage increases.

This position is a DOT (Department of Transportation) covered classification and is subject to random drug and/or alcohol screening.

May vary from 20% - 50% office to office travel, with minimum overnight travel.

Job Responsibilities

Evaluates compliance with PG&E guidance documents for maintenance and construction documentation per established quality review processes.
50% ensures submitted documentation is complete and accurate; 50% ensures field work is preformed correctly; safety standards and procedures have been followed and work was completed in a timely manner and per company requirements.
Follows established corrective action process for quality findings, leveraging the Corrective Action Program when appropriate
Collaborates with appropriate stakeholders to inform, initiate, and ensure correction when discrepancies are found.
Communicates with field personnel and supervisors to ensure resolution of issues in an appropriate and timely manner.
Communicates with peers inside and outside of the department providing information and exchanging ideas and data.
Works independently and uses various methods, approaches and tactics to resolve problems and obtain solutions.
Adheres to data and record management as required
Work Procedures and Standards & Policies pertaining to assigned QA/QC work.
Ability to learn new concepts quickly and adapt to changing business conditions and ambiguity.
Organizational skills.
Ability to work in a team environment.
Verbal and written communication skills.
Conflict resolution skills including listening and persuasion to obtain compliance.
Qualifications

Minimum :
Must be at least 18 years of age
Must possess a High School diploma, GED, or equivalent work experience
Must have a valid California Driver's License
Ability to work in all types of weather extremes
Ability to drive safely in all weather and road conditions
Ability to work extended hours, nights, weekends and holidays
Ability to travel and transfer to a new headquarter upon request at any time; throughout the entire PG&E service territory with no guarantees as to how long you will be away from home.
Must be able to wear company provided Personal Protective Equipment (PPE)
Must be able to lift up to 75 pounds a minimum of one time a day
Desired :
Experience in field work, gas and auto-cad
Ability to demonstrate basic to intermediate Microsoft Project, Excel, Word, and Office skills
Ability to demonstrate strong math and computer skills, strong written and verbal communication and an attention to detail
Pre-Employment Testing
PG&E Employees: You must have qualified on all prerequisite tests prior to submitting an application, and all secondary tests prior to interviewing. For more information on prerequisite and secondary exams, including study guides, please visit the Pre-employment testing program website.
Physical Test Battery

title: Fixture Designer
description:
Workplace Flexibility: Hybrid
Are you looking for a company that cares about people’s lives and health, including yours? Let’s inspire healthier lives, together.

Olympus, a leading medical technology company, has focused on making people’s lives better for over 100 years.
Our Purpose is to make people’s lives healthier, safer, and more fulfilling.

Our Core Values are reflected in all we do: Integrity – Empathy – Agility – Unity – Long-Term View

We deliver on our purpose and our core values by staying True to Life.
Job Description
The Fixture Designer is responsible for the development of manufacturing fixtures to aid in the assembly of single use flexible endoscopes. The primary responsibilities of this role include supporting all phases of device development, including aiding in the assembly of functional models, prototypes, and serial production units. Close collaboration with Development and Manufacturing Engineers is critical with the goal of reducing the assembly time needed for large volume production. Within a team environment, it will be expected that he or she will be a proactive communicator, collaborate well with others, manage their work efficiently, produce high quality work and consistently seek additional knowledge and skills. Documenting engineering files will be an important aspect of this role, as well as helping to generate assembly procedures to aid users of the fixturing; therefore, a working knowledge of Medical Device serial manufacturing is required.
Job Duties
Contributes to product development projects and/or technology development efforts.
Contributes to the development process and transfer of designs into manufacturing.
Develops creative solutions to minimize touch time during the assembly of single use flexible endoscopes.
Collaborates with Development and Manufacturing Engineers to understand the product assembly needs.
May collaborate with Automation Engineers.
Collaborates with Olympus Patent Attorneys to secure a strong IP portfolio as needed.
Documents designs within a document control system.
Supports in ensuring product and performance specifications are appropriate and accurate.
Supports internal and external suppliers and manufacturers as needed. Including external design and/or development partners.
Supports engineering leadership as required.
All additional duties as directed.
Job Qualifications
Required:
High School Degree. (Bachelors in mechanical engineering is preferred)
Minimum years of related experience: 20 with high school degree, 9 years with BS.
Proficient using CAD/3D modelling software (SolidWorks is preferred).
Knowledge of a wide range of manufacturing methods (CNC machining, laser welding, 3D printing, etc.).
Knowledge of a wide range of materials (Stainless Steel, Aluminium, Polymers, etc.).
Knowledge of manufacturing methods common to sterile single use medical devices.
Experience designing fixturing used to assemble sub-millimeter sized components.
Able to solve complicated technical challenges and use good judgement in making timely decisions.
Must be able to collaborate effectively with others, works well within cross-functional teams and across multiple sites, as applicable.
Must be capable to effectively executing multiple work streams in parallel.
Must be able to communicate effectively, both verbally and in writing. Comfortable presenting information to team members and stakeholders.
Must be able to work in a professional open-space environment without distracting others.
Must have a positive attitude and capable of accomplishing efforts in a timely manner and with high quality.

Preferred:
Experience designing automation equipment is preferred.
Why join Olympus?
Here, people matter—our health, our happiness, and our lives.
Competitive salaries, annual bonus and 401(k)* with company match
Comprehensive Medical, Dental, Visions coverage effective on start date
24/7 Employee Assistance Program
Free virtual live and on-demand wellness classes
Work-life balance supportive culture with hybrid and remote roles
12 Paid Holidays
Educational Assistance
Parental Leave and Adoption Assistance
Volunteering and charitable donation match programs
Diversity & Inclusion Programs including Colleague Affinity Networks
On-Site Child Daycare, Café, Fitness Center**
US Only
**Limited locations

We care about your health and financial well-being and offer the resources you need to feel vital, confident and ready for wherever life takes you. Learn more about our benefit offerings at https://www.olympusamerica.com/careers/benefits-perks.
The anticipated base pay range for this full-time position working at this location is $115,026.00 - $161,036.00 / year, plus potential for annual bonus (subject to plan eligibility and other requirements). Olympus considers a variety of factors when determining actual compensation for this position including: level of experience, working location, and relevant education and certifications.
About us:
Our Medical business uses innovative capabilities in medical technology, therapeutic intervention, and precision manufacturing to help healthcare professionals deliver diagnostic, therapeutic, and minimally invasive procedures to improve clinical outcomes, reduce costs, and enhance the quality of life for patients and their safety.

Headquartered in Tokyo, Japan, Olympus employs more than 31,000 employees worldwide in nearly 40 countries and regions. Olympus Corporation of the Americas, a wholly owned subsidiary of Olympus Corporation, is headquartered in Center Valley, Pennsylvania, USA, and employs more than 5,200 employees throughout locations in North and South America. For more information, visit www.olympusamerica.com.

Olympus is dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace
We recognize diversity in people, views and lifestyle choices and emphasize the importance of inclusion and mutual respect. We strive to continue to foster empathy and unity in the workplace so that our employees can fully contribute and thrive.

Let’s realize your potential, together.

title: Engineering Technician, Electronic Devices
description:
Tesla participates in the E-Verify Program
What to Expect
We are seeking a driven and motivated Engineering Technician to join our Electronic Devices Design team. This individual will work very closely with multiple engineering teams and is expected to drive validation tasks and work independently with minimal supervision. The work will include hands-on engagement involving thermal, mechanical, electrical, and control systems. The ideal candidate is mechanically inclined, a self-starter, and able to learn new concepts quickly.
What You’ll Do
Assemble and disassemble electronics modules with precision and attention to detail
Efficiently handle multiple priorities, organize workload, and meet critical deadlines
Construct and install testing fixtures to ensure accurate and reliable test setups
Uphold a clean and organized laboratory space, actively managing inventory to optimize efficiency
Collaborate with engineering teams to develop and implement test setups, ensuring alignment with test requirements
Autonomously conduct tests, collecting and recording data for analysis
Perform post-processing of data obtained during testing, applying analytical techniques to extract meaningful insights
Fabricate and install thermocouples for comprehensive data collection, ensuring the accuracy and integrity of results
Conduct triage on assembled components, identifying and reporting any issues to the relevant stakeholders
Document test procedure, setups, and results clearly and concisely
What You’ll Bring
2+ years of hands-on experience in manufacturing assembly of electronics as an engineering technician
Proficiency in installation and operation of variety of sensors and gauges with a comprehensive understanding of their functionalities
Fluent and proficient with common hand tools, power tools, and hardware for various assembly tasks
Expertise in teardowns and the repair of electronic components, with a strong emphasis on constructing electronics assemblies
Good documentation skills to ensure easy data access and organization
Working knowledge of Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint, facilitating effective communication and reporting
Experience with Python programming and automation techniques preferred, enhancing efficiency in technical processes
Familiarity with data acquisition systems preferred, further contributing to the candidate's proficiency in the role.
Familiarity with 3D printing, rapid prototyping methodologies, and CAD software preferred, reflecting a holistic understanding of modern manufacturing practices
Compensation and Benefits
Benefits

Along with competitive pay, as a full-time Tesla employee, you are eligible for the following benefits at day 1 of hire:
Aetna PPO and HSA plans > 2 medical plan options with $0 payroll deduction
Family-building, fertility, adoption and surrogacy benefits
Dental (including orthodontic coverage) and vision plans, both have options with a $0 paycheck contribution
Company Paid (Health Savings Account) HSA Contribution when enrolled in the High Deductible Aetna medical plan with HSA
Healthcare and Dependent Care Flexible Spending Accounts (FSA)
LGBTQ+ care concierge services
401(k) with employer match, Employee Stock Purchase Plans, and other financial benefits
Company paid Basic Life, AD&D, short-term and long-term disability insurance
Employee Assistance Program
Sick and Vacation time (Flex time for salary positions), and Paid Holidays
Back-up childcare and parenting support resources
Voluntary benefits to include: critical illness, hospital indemnity, accident insurance, theft & legal services, and pet insurance
Weight Loss and Tobacco Cessation Programs
Tesla Babies program
Commuter benefits
Employee discounts and perks program

Expected Compensation

$24.40 - $65.40/hour + cash and stock awards + benefits

title: 2024 Engineer Development Rotation Program (Gloucester, MA) - ME, EE, Process Engineering
description:
Applied Materials is the leader in materials engineering solutions used to produce virtually every new chip and advanced display in the world. Our expertise in modifying materials at atomic levels and on an industrial scale helps our customers – who make smartphones, supercomputers, virtual reality headsets, autonomous vehicles and more – transform their ideas into reality. Our innovations Make Possible® a Better Future.

Inside our company, we apply the idea of make possible as we work together. We value our people and teams who turn possibilities into reality by advancing our strategy, accomplishing great things and empowering others. We are deeply committed to fostering a Culture of Inclusion where every person knows they belong, feels empowered to bring their whole self to work, and is inspired to grow.

If you’re looking for a great place to grow your career, consider Applied Materials. With the data explosion and new investment in semiconductors, it’s an exciting place to be.

Join the Fusion Team in 2024! Fusion is a rotational training program within the Applied Materials Varian Semiconductor Equipment business unit located in Gloucester, MA. It is designed to attract, assimilate, grow, and retain the most talented engineers entering the industry today.

During the first two years of employment, Fusion members go through a series of rotational work assignments. The rotations typically consist of three or four unique engineering departmental assignments and one manufacturing department assignment. These rotations help Fusion members and managers determine where the Fusion member will flourish in their full-time position at Applied Materials.

Positions in the below areas are available for 2024
Electrical Engineer
Mechanical Engineer
Process Engineer

Requirements
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree from an accredited institution awarded within one year of start date
Fields of study preferred:

Electrical Engineering
Mechanical Engineering
Materials Science & Engineering
Chemistry
Physics

Student must be in good academic standing at their university, with a preferred GPA of 3.0 or above on a 4.0 scale
Thrive in results-oriented culture
Flexible & adaptable mindset
Qualifications
Education:
Bachelor's Degree (Required), Master's Degree
Skills
Certifications:
Languages:

Up to 1 Year
Work Experience:

Travel:
Yes, 10% of the Time

Yes

$68,000.00 - $93,500.00

title: Manufacturing Engineer, Cell Cathode Engineering
description:
Tesla participates in the E-Verify Program
What to Expect
Tesla is scaling the production of novel cathode materials for use in its broad application of battery technology. The Mechanical Design Engineer role within this team will participate in the design and development of new cathode processing equipment, materials development, and knowledge transfer. The engineer will be responsible for carrying process equipment and systems from design through to installation and commissioning.
What You’ll Do
Develop and execute equipment and system level designs to improve process performance, efficiency and reduce cost
Evaluate and address process and equipment challenges on constricted timelines
Own design, prototyping and analysis of novel equipment
Lead/support installation and commissioning activities in a chemical manufacturing environment
Define/Author technical specifications (dimensional, functional, performance, manufacturing)
Sourcing and managing of engineering relationships with suppliers
Author technical documentation and deliver technical presentations
Create implementation plans for rapid turnaround process changes
Own and execute projects blended design disciplines including: thermal systems, piping, solids handling, structural, mechanical mechanisms, and chemical treatment and synthesis
Create and support cost modeling for commercial scale process implementation
What You’ll Bring
Bachelor’s Degree in Mechanical Engineering, Chemical Engineering, Engineering Physics, or equivalent experience
1-3+ years of experience
Strong fundamentals of mechanical fundamentals (mechanics of solids, thermodynamics, fluid dynamics, heat transfer, etc.)
Familiarity with properties and application of common engineering materials
Strong understanding of mechanical design tools (2D/3D CAD programs, modeling suites)
Familiarity with fabrication practices (machining, sheet metal, welding, additive manufacturing)
Understanding of GD&T practices
